pull.title: Modified in_addr6 cast in CConman class to work with msvc
pull.body: Fix to allow net.cpp to compile with MSVC. Without this fix the `(in6_addr)IN6ADDR_ANY_INIT` implicit cast generates a compilation error.

events.body:
Looks like this breaks everything but the Windows builds.
Linux:
```
net.cpp: In member function 'bool CConnman::InitBinds(const std::vector<CService>&, const std::vector<CService>&)':
net.cpp:2257:25: error: variable 'CConnman::InitBinds(const std::vector<CService>&, const std::vector<CService>&)::in_addr6 inaddr6_any' has initializer but incomplete type
         struct in_addr6 inaddr6_any = IN6ADDR_ANY_INIT;
                         ^~~~~~~~~~~
make[2]: *** [libbitcoin_server_a-net.o] Error 1
Makefile:5954: recipe for target 'libbitcoin_server_a-net.o' failed
```
macOS:
```
libbitcoin_server_a-net.o `test -f 'net.cpp' || echo './'`net.cpp
net.cpp:2257:25: error: variable has incomplete type 'struct in_addr6'
        struct in_addr6 inaddr6_any = IN6ADDR_ANY_INIT;
                        ^
net.cpp:2257:16: note: forward declaration of 'in_addr6'
        struct in_addr6 inaddr6_any = IN6ADDR_ANY_INIT;
               ^
1 error generated.
make[2]: *** [libbitcoin_server_a-net.o] Error 1
Makefile:5954: recipe for target 'libbitcoin_server_a-net.o' failed
```
Back to the drawing board then. I'll try and find an approach that works on Linux as well as Windows.
Looks like just a missing include for in6_addr?

@sipa the includes are good. The compilation error is:

> Error	C4576	a parenthesized type followed by an initializer list is a non-standard explicit type conversion syntax	libbitcoin_server	c:\dev\github\bitcoin-msvc\src\net.cpp	2258	

The define on Windows (ws2ipdef.h) is:

`#define IN6ADDR_ANY_INIT {{{ 0 }}}`

@sipsorcery I mean the build error in this PR looks like in6_addr is not defined.

Alternatively, maybe "inaddr6_any" is a macro on some platforms? Try another variable name.
So looks like `in_addr6` for MSVC, `in6_addr` for gcc
MSVC also uses in6_addr (there is an extra in_addr6 alias that I inadvertently used). I'll adjust the PR.

events.message: Modified in_addr6 cast in CConman class to work with msvc.
